action: I want to visualize key KPIs such as sales, progress, and customer status in real-time
reason: Because I need to make quick, data-driven decisions based on accurate evidence
acceptance_criteria: The system shall allow only authenticated users to access the dashboard data.
The system must restrict KPI viewing privileges based on the user's assigned role.
The system shall enforce row-level security to limit displayed data to the user's authorized scope.
The system must support data aggregation by variable time periods (daily, weekly, monthly, yearly) for Sales KPIs.
The system shall provide progress rate KPIs aggregated on a per-project basis.
The system must provide structured data capable of supporting line, bar, and pie chart visualizations.
The system shall ensure data consistency by retrieving numerical and graphical data from a unified source.
The system must support data updates via periodic batch processes or real-time API ingestion.
The system shall target an API response time of under 1 second for dashboard data retrieval.
The system must implement a configurable caching mechanism to optimize performance.
The system shall execute heavy aggregation queries asynchronously to prevent database overload.
The system must use parameterized queries for all database interactions to prevent SQL injection.
The system shall sanitize all input filter values to prevent Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks.
The system must return an error for invalid date range specifications and return zero values for periods with no data.
The system shall respect user-specific time zone settings for all data aggregation.
The system must log all dashboard access events for auditing purposes.
The system shall support exporting dashboard data to CSV and PDF formats after verifying permissions.
The system must enforce rate limiting on dashboard APIs to prevent resource exhaustion.
The system shall store user-specific layout preferences and widget visibility settings in the database.
The system must log any changes to data source configurations or dashboard settings in an immutable audit log.
The system shall store audit logs in tamper-evident storage to prevent modification.
The system must enforce HTTPS (TLS 1.2+) for all data transmission.
